content: Thanks to the new VFW magazine and their highlight of WW2 in this months issue. A very interesting site to visit is, -http://www.tule-lake.com/tulelake/internment/neverdark.shtml Just take the dash off of this cold link. Tule Lake was a Japanese internment camp. Some of it survives today. Exceptional site giving much info on how it was to liveduring those times.

title: Tule-Lake

content: Tule Lake is beautiful country and well worth a visit. Not only are the remnants of the internment camp there, but the lava fields were the site of the final act of the Modoc Wars, where Gen. Canfield was murdered during peace negotiations with Capt. Jack. Of course, you should remember that all those maginficent, snow-capped mountains around there are active volcanoes!
reply: Tule Lake is beautiful country and well worth a visit. Not only are the remnants of the internment camp there, but the lava fields were the site of the final act of the Modoc Wars, where Gen. content: Uh that was General Canby that was killed by Capt. Jack. The lava beds and Captain Jacks stronghold. My Grandsons love to go there. Another cave of the Modoc warriors. More hieroglyphs. Captain Jacks HQ was not very big but it provided great cover and his soldiers were excellent shots. There is a monolith near there that is sacred to the Modoc and has many hieroglyphics. One of the many caves they hid in. A Wama Suc Abinake of mine friend stands in the prayer circle of the Modoc. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

title: Tule-Lake

content: The Modoc's ancestors would ride their canoes up to this monolith and carve their tale's into the stone. The lake was drained to be used as farmland. Enjoy those potatoes and onions, cause they are being grown in the old lake bed. 200 Modoc men women and children held off the US Army. The terrain doesn't look too bad until you try to walk a distance in a straight line. It's Lava rock and it's sharp and pointy. Sacred rock, lava rock and determination kept these people in their caves. The trails are from the Modocs seige but mainly there because of the parks design. They have a short trail and a long trail. A lot of natural hiding places. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

content: You're right. It was Canby. My mistake. That terrain doesn't look like a place I'd relish fighting a battle, especially on the side of the offense.
reply: You're right. It was Canby. My mistake. That terrain doesn't look like a place I'd relish fighting a battle, especially on the side of the offense.
title: Tule-Lake

content: It is some tough terrain, imagine fighting in the lava fields in Hawaii or similar terrain. The land around the lava fields is flat for the most part but the surrounding hills can be tough going. The hieroglyphics are on this huge rock which was surrounded by water before they drained the lake My favorite part of this area is the rock and the writings and pictures. Some person stood in a boat and took the time to make these thousands of years ago. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?
